Below is a list of featured clips from my experience as a journalist.

Sinking Beneath the Surface

Her attempt to take her own life in the February of her second year was not the first.
But it was the first time Savannah Badalich realized that she needed to seek out professional help for her depression and suicidal thoughts, which were weighing heavier on her each day as she tried to occupy herself with other things.

Relevant awards: California College Media Association Best Magazine Story First Place

Amid destruction, midwives bring life

ONGAPO, Philippines — The team of midwives had no choice but to ride on top of the ambulance because piles of precious medical supplies occupied their seats below.

Her Second Chance

TANAUAN, Philippines — Only the floor of the clinic was left, surrounded by wet piles of rubble left after several 16-foot waves devastated the coastal town.

Larceny offenses lead area crime rates

Data reporting compiled from statistics provided by the Virginia State Police. The story analyzes the data and the interactive graphics tell visual stories that compare the eight counties the Free Lance-Star covers to others in the state.

Aug 2, 2014

Back in the Ranks: A soldier finds a new home, new loyalties in LA

After four years as an officer in the British Army, Oliver Kay ventured to a new city, Los Angeles, to get his education. He graduated with recognition for excellence in service from UCLA in September, and commissioned as a military intelligence officer, this time under a different flag.
